Package org.zamia.vg

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    VGContentProvider<NodeType,PortType,SignalType>  
    VGGC
    A graphics context to paint a graph onto
    VGLabelProvider<NodeType,PortType,SignalType>  
    VGSelectionProvider<NodeType,SignalType>
    Used to highlight nodes and signals while painting a layout
    VGSymbol<NodeType,PortType,SignalType>
    A symbol is a graphical representation of a node
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    VGBox<NodeType,PortType,SignalType>
    Wrapper around underlying graph nodes contains utility functions (getSuccessors, num connected inputs, ...) and layout information
    VGChannel<NodeType,PortType,SignalType>
    A vertical module placement and wiring channel
    VGGCSVG
    VGGC implementation that produces an SVG file
    VGGenericSymbol<NodeType,PortType,SignalType>
    A generic symbol which represents any RTL module as a rectangular box, Handles any number of input and output ports
    VGLayout<NodeType,PortType,SignalType>  
    VGPort<NodeType,PortType,SignalType>
    Wrapper around underlying port type Main reason this exists is that we have VGBoxes for primary inputs/outputs which have no gate (and therefore no port) counterparts in the underlying model Also, it is nice to have a complete abstraction layer here so we can store additional information in the future and do not have to fall back to VGContentProvider during place&route once the VG* wrappers have been generated.
    VGPortSymbol<NodeType,PortType,SignalType>  
    VGSignal<NodeType,PortType,SignalType>
    Wrapper around underlying signal type It is nice to have a complete abstraction layer here so we can store additional information in the future and do not have to fall back to VGContentProvider during place&route once the VG* wrappers have been generated.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    VGGC.VGColor  
    VGGC.VGFont
